full_text: Today is #EpilepsyDay and with an estimated 1,178 people living with epilepsy in Cork East, @epilepsyireland want to make seizure first aid general knowledge amongst the Irish public. On the Temporary Energy Support Scheme announced today, it’s hard to see how a monthly cap of €10k will meet the needs of businesses that have been in touch with me, who’s energy costs have quadrupled in some cases #Budget2023

€238m for Agri-Food sector from Brexit Adjustment Reserve (BAR).  Have not seen evidence for the large scale deployment of this fund to date in fisheries sector in response to Brexit so don’t hold your breath @ISWFPO #Budget2023Ireland #AnIrelandthatworks

€81m in carbon tax receipts for Department of Agriculture for new agri climate rural environment scheme .. for biodiversity, air and water quality.  No specific mention of forestry targets though!! To be clarified…. @SEEFAssociation #Budget2023Ireland #AnIrelandthatworks

The one off payment to carers of €500 is welcome but We we’re hopeful that the income threshold would be raised for working families who care for loved ones (to allow them to qualify for a weekly carers payment) #Budget2023 #AnIrelandthatworks

Fuel Allowance Threshold: “⬆️ in the means threshold for fuel allowance for those aged 70+ to €500 PW (€1000 for a couple). Increase the fuel allowance threshold from €120 to €200 PW above the rate of State Pension Comtributory (€80 increase) #Budget2023 #AnIrelandthatworks
